name: mahonia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an evergreen bush (= one that never loses its leaves) that has yellow flowers with a sweet smell: Mahonia has dark green foliage that offsets its scented, lemon-yellow flowers. All mahonias smell good, but this is perhaps the most fragrant of all.
More examplesFewer examplesWinter-flowering plants such as mahonia not only add fragrance and colour but are an important food source for birds and insects.In Holland, mahonia is often planted in the strips dividing a suburban road from the subsidiary road for bicycle traffic.
